Connor MacLeod.Action: The Old Man helps the Young Man to his feet and advises him to control his anger, showing patience and guidance.
The Old Man smiles when the Young Man says he needs to see someone else’s face, indicating friendly tolerance.
The Old Man clears away dishes after the Young Man leaves, a mundane, caring action.
The Old Man senses danger (premonition) but does not warn or stop the Young Man from leaving.
The Old Man smiles at the Young Man upon his return despite previous tension, showing warmth.
The Old Man turns his back, leaving himself vulnerable to possible attack by the Young Man raising his sword behind him; possible trust or naivety.
Successfully parries a surprise sword attack with a fluid movement, swiftly counterattacks, and injures the assailant.
No direct action or presence in the scene; the excerpt focuses on Old Man and Kilvara's fight.
Warns the Punk to 'Go home -- while you still can,' attempting to avoid conflict.
Does not engage aggressively initially, tries to de-escalate before defending himself.
Uses a pipe to defend himself when threatened.
Turns his back and walks away after the threat dissipates, showing restraint.
Does not turn immediately when approached threat emerges, stays calm and detached, assessing the situation quietly.
Warns the Punk to go home while confidently preparing for confrontation, shows readiness by pulling a pipe and twirling it expertly.
Maintains intense, confident eye contact that unnerves the opponent and causes the threat to retreat without physical violence.
Drops the pipe and walks away after ensuring the threat has left, showing controlled confidence and situational awareness.
Watches Rachel affectionately and painfully from the shadows, hesitates to touch her, then weakly smiles and reconnects sincerely without words.
Acknowledges danger but reassures Rachel he can protect himself, showing concern and calm.
Confides in Rachel about Brenda's death and his loneliness, showing vulnerability and seeking connection.
Responds politely and gratefully when Rachel offers tea service.
Lays his head on Rachel's shoulder like a baby, indicating trust and emotional openness.
Expresses emotional vulnerability and fatigue openly to Rachel, seeking comfort after years of isolation and loss.
Walks through library and selects a poetry book, showing thoughtful reflection.
Appears concerned observing the lightning outside, indicating awareness of possible impending trouble.
Shares a lighthearted joke with the Farmer, causing them both to laugh.
Accepts water shyly offered by Sarah and responds with a friendly wink, making her blush.
Responds respectfully and politely to the Farmer regarding Sarah, expressing protective but sincere regard.
Works hard for six months and asks for little, showing a responsible and trustworthy character.
Works diligently behind an ox, showing physical endurance and commitment to hard labor.
Engages in light, playful banter with the farmer and Sarah, showing social ease and confidence.
Politely rebuffs romantic advancements with thoughtful reasoning, demonstrating emotional intelligence and self-control.
Goes about his work quietly without drawing unnecessary attention.
Rescues Sarah from warrior, confronting aggressors and protecting innocent.
Lethally attacks invading warriors without mercy.
Steps out to confront armed warriors who have taken a child and attacks them skillfully and decisively with a sword, demonstrating excellent combat proficiency.
Effortlessly sidesteps an attack and kills one warrior quickly, showing confidence and mastery in combat.
Simultaneously throws his sword as a spear and fires a crossbow to neutralize the second warrior, demonstrating quick thinking and multitasking under pressure.
Gently wipes Sarah's tears away and speaks soothingly despite his pain.
Expresses love sincerely and comforts Sarah about leaving.
Acknowledges Sarah's love and reciprocates with sadness.
Despite having an arrow lodged in his chest and bleeding, he calmly pulls it out and walks into the barn, showing physical resilience and self-control.
Recognizes the danger his presence causes and decides to leave to protect others from harm.
Acknowledges uncertainty about how he survived the arrow wound honestly.
Shows emotional vulnerability during his final moments but maintains composure by comforting Sarah and advising her not to cry.
Thanks the Farmer sincerely for his help and expresses gratitude despite their difference in understanding.
Offers his hand to the Farmer, showing an attempt at connection, but understands when it is not accepted and respects it without forcing.
Walks off alone into the night after parting from the Farmer, accepting solitude without complaint.
Acknowledges the Farmer's gesture of gratitude and departs quietly and alone into the night, demonstrating self-reliance and acceptance of his fate.
Looks out the window reflectively and reads poetry aloud, pondering his journey and responsibilities, showing introspection and thoughtful awareness.
Stares out the window sadly upon sensing troubling events.
Cautiously holds on to his Samurai sword despite the other's reassurance.
Bolkts up in bed after sensing a distant supernatural event, showing alertness and responsiveness.
Stops his horse on a country road when a premonition fills him, demonstrating awareness and caution.
Slowly reaches for his samurai sword when confronted by a stranger appearing suddenly above him, indicating readiness and prudent caution.
Engages in measured dialogue with Thomas Cavanaugh and does not impulsively attack, showing social intelligence and self-control.
Responds with sadness when mentioning his brother's death, showing emotional openness.
Follows Cavenaugh to meet others, indicating trust and willingness to engage with new people.
Questions the dangers of passing on knowledge (concern about others taking his head), showing caution but also hint of reluctance.
Acknowledges death of brother with sadness but remains composed.
Questions Cavenaugh about identity and intentions, showing caution and curiosity.
Decides to follow Cavenaugh despite initial hesitation, indicating willingness to engage and learn.
Listens silently, stands apart from the group, eyes on the altar but mind elsewhere.
Questions the value of the prize, reflects on the cost of the fight and the suffering it causes.
Says he grows weary of the fight, implying a desire for peace or respite.
Listens quietly and contemplates the meaning of the prize and the cost involved, showing thoughtful reflection and awareness of the gravity of the situation.
Questions the value of the prize and acknowledges the changing world, indicating insight and realistic thinking.
Appears distant and weary, expressing fatigue with the ongoing conflict.
Does not actively engage in debate or action during the gathering, standing apart and not intervening.
Stops fighting and mounts his horse, expressing weariness but also resolve to not continue searching for destiny, showing a calm acceptance rather than panic.
Smiles and kisses Rachel on the forehead after she gives him the keys.
Sits alone in church deep in thought, distant and uncommunicative with the priest, refuses confession.
Confidently interacts with Rachel, retrieves keys and takes initiative to go out, showing control over his environment and resources.
Sits alone in deep thought at the church altar, indicating introspection but no decisive action taken in the scene.
Declines to open up or seek help from the Priest, showing emotional reservation which may limit effectiveness in resolving inner conflict.
Looks at the Priest sadly and speaks with a tone of sorrow about never having gifts like life, children, growing old, dying, and heaven.
Attempts to de-escalate conflict by telling the Horseman 'Wait. We don't have to do this.' before the fight begins.
Acknowledges futility of talking to the hostile Horseman with cold, savage eyes and accepts combat inevitability.
Moves quickly to dodge the Horseman’s sword, narrowly avoiding injury.
Expertly draws and twirls an ancient Samurai sword and assumes a fighting stance confidently.
Engages skillfully in a sword fight, landing a deep gash on the opponent’s face.
Attempts to negotiate and stop the fight by raising his hand and saying 'Wait. We don’t have to do this.'
Expresses sadness and bitterness about his immortality and losses during a conversation with the Priest.
Responds with irritation to Cavanaugh’s singing but continues the journey without confrontation.
Uses the environment cleverly by throwing a meat hook to incapacitate the Horseman, then quickly draws his sword to be ready for combat.
Decapitates the Horseman decisively in one fluid motion, demonstrating skill and confidence.
Recovers from exhaustion and immediately retrieves his sword before fleeing, showing situational awareness and survival instinct.
Shows impatience and irritation toward Cavanaugh’s singing, potentially indicating difficulty in managing interpersonal dynamics or stress.
Shrugs to show he doesn't care about life anymore.
Sits quietly, lost in thought without engaging Cavanaugh.
Blocks Cavanaugh's sudden sword attack quickly and effectively using his Samurai sword.
Shrugs and admits he doesn't care if he lives or dies, showing emotional detachment and possible lack of motivation.
Listens carefully and responds thoughtfully to Cavanaugh's philosophical challenges.
Decides to leave England after realizing there is nothing left for him, showing awareness and decisiveness.
Holds out his hand to Cavanaugh and thanks him for being a friend when needed, expresses hope to meet again as friends.
Expresses a prayerful wish to never have to fight a friend, showing respect and emotional sincerity.
Decides to leave England to seek himself in another land, acknowledging uncertainty but showing resolve and self-awareness.
Expresses hope to not have to fight a friend, showing emotional intelligence and thoughtful restraint.
Does not provide a definitive answer when asked what he would do if forced to fight a friend, instead prays for the best outcome.

No direct action or involvement in the scene, no demonstration of skill or confidence.
Touches Rachel's face lightly, showing a gentle and caring side.

Touches Rachel's face lightly, showing emotional vulnerability but also careful control over interpersonal interaction.
Shrugs off Bedsoe's questioning about the severed head, not revealing panic or confusion, indicating composure under pressure.
Fails to respond to Bedsoe’s direct question about timing of return, which could suggest withholding information or hesitation.
Maintains calm and confident demeanor during interrogation, refuses to reveal personal information.
Gives brief, guarded answers without getting flustered or evasive.
Shows sadness when talking about Brenda but keeps focus on interrogation.
Stares at Bedsoe through the mirror as if he knows exactly what is going on.
Embraces Cavanaugh warmly upon seeing him, showing affection and friendliness.
Teases Cavanaugh gently about feeling sick at sea, showing playful tolerance and good-natured behavior.
Grins as he watches Cavanaugh feeling ill, then his grin fades, showing concern.
Refuses to let Gaston take his bag, maintaining personal boundaries politely.
Engages politely with Gaston and responds with a lighthearted joke about the journey.
Turns towards Jennifer, face betrays nothing; responds curtly and questions her intentions.
Does not initially engage in friendly or open communication, dismisses Jennifer's attempts to talk.
Advises Jennifer to go home and stay out of trouble, showing concern for her safety.

Shows frustration that Jennifer won't take his advice, but does not act harshly or aggressively.
Guesses correctly the location related to corpses in Scotland, showing awareness of setting.
Identifies a plausible explanation that the man survived gunshots because he wore a bulletproof vest, demonstrating logical thinking.
Advises Jennifer to stay out of danger, showing prudence and concern.
Shows frustration when Jennifer does not follow his advice, indicating a degree of emotional control but also irritation.
Immediately recognizes significance of Jennifer's ring and questions her about it with intensity and focus, showing investigative skill and attention to detail.

Feigns a grin for Rachel's sake and kisses her on the forehead before continuing down the hall.
Says nothing to Jennifer when looking back at her before elevator doors close.
Responds to Rachel's question about what he will do with a resigned, 'There's nothing I can do. I'll wait.'
Responds calmly to Rachel's question despite underlying tension; feigns a grin for her sake, showing emotional control and consideration.
Admits to Rachel that he cannot act and will wait for resolution, showing acceptance of limits but potentially a lack of proactive problem-solving.
Observes his surroundings carefully in the ballroom and notices Isabelle Tourezz, displaying alertness and awareness.

Notices Cavanaugh's distraction and gently probes to find out what's wrong, demonstrating perceptiveness and interpersonal awareness.
Acknowledges Cavanaugh's warning about the risks of his relationship but maintains his decision, showing resolve and understanding of consequences.
Remembers his lost wife Heather with sadness, showing emotional depth and sincerity.
Responds to Cavanaugh’s concern with sad resignation, showing honest vulnerability.
Climbs the dangerous balcony to meet Isabelle, demonstrating loyalty and care toward her.
Addresses Isabelle tenderly as 'blossom' and shares intimate moment, showing affectionate and warm behavior.
States he cannot stay with Isabelle and plans to leave in the morning, indicating a sense of responsibility though somewhat withholding emotional commitment.
Listens to Cavanaugh's advice and contemplates the pain of past loss realistically.
Takes a calculated risk by climbing the stone wall at night to enter the royal apartments, demonstrating courage and skill.
Acknowledges emotional pain and uncertainty ('What am I to do?'), showing some vulnerability but also realistic self-awareness.
Decides to infiltrate a dangerous location despite the risks, showing decisive action and confidence.
Gently gives Isabelle a ring that belonged to Jennifer, telling her to remember that it came from someone who loved her, and kisses her forehead before leaving.
Tells Isabelle he must leave and that she cannot follow, refusing to explain further despite her hurt and pleading.
Calmly explains the need to leave without giving full explanations to Isabelle, showing control over sensitive information.
Symbolically passes a ring to Isabelle to keep memory alive, showing emotional intelligence and thoughtful action.
Handles a tense situation with guards by remaining confident and asserting control, refusing to be intimidated.
Leaves Isabelle despite her emotional pleas and desire to accompany him, potentially showing emotional distance or lack of openness.

Holds the sword to a guard's throat but hesitates in anger, indicating a decision not to kill immediately.
Volunteers to be executed first instead of letting Cavanaugh go first despite Cavanaugh standing first.
Quickly draws his sword and blocks a sudden attack with precise timing, protecting Gaston and giving the command to leave.
Engages skillfully in combat, disarms an opponent, and holds him at sword point showing control and tactical advantage.
Maintains composure when outnumbered and looks to his companion for coordinated action.
Volunteers to face execution first, showing resolve and leadership under dire circumstances.

Asks about the guillotine in an innocent manner, tries to negotiate less painful execution methods, shows composure while his companion is being executed, and anticipates the guards' moves with cold, focused attention.
Looks at the headless body with sadness before escaping.
Holds Jennifer's business card and flicks it thoughtfully, showing a connection to her.

Conceals sword and prepares to engage a police officer threateningly, while Jennifer watches helplessly.
Effortlessly breaks his ropes after receiving energy, demonstrating physical and mental strength.
Uses a hidden mechanism (bookcase opens to staircase) to escape surveillance, indicating resourcefulness and planning.
Stops and waits calmly upon hearing footsteps, showing situational awareness and caution.
Reaches for his sword under his coat as a threat approaches, preparing to defend himself.
Continues walking away despite a clear threat appearing behind him (police officer with raised sword), potentially indicating overconfidence or lack of immediate reaction.
Turns around immediately upon hearing Jennifer's scream, protecting himself from the attack.
Does not retaliate with excessive aggression; pushes Kilvara back with head but then runs off, avoiding unnecessary harm.
Stands calmly in front of the church without raising his sword when confronted by Kilvara.

Remains silent and calm while faced with Kilvara's taunts and threats, showing controlled confidence.
Replies calmly to Kilvara's threats and reassures that it will not end tonight.
Answers Jennifer's concern about his injury and the situation with a brief but honest reply.

Expresses self-doubt about having lived life and the good he has done.

After the deadly fight, steps away calmly without drawing further attention, allowing the authorities to handle the situation.

Threatens the attacker confidently and shows readiness to act decisively to protect the woman.
Engages in a sword fight, successfully defends himself, and kills the attacker by beheading him, then calmly leaves the scene undetected.
Shows calm composure after the fight, walking away in the fog while others panic, indicating skill and confidence in dangerous situations.
Patiently helps an elderly woman select silver serving trays, allowing her to make her own decision without pressure.
Shows annoyance when Jennifer arrives, indicating some impatience or irritation.
Engages Jennifer with a personal comment about her resembling someone he knew, showing some openness and personal connection.

Is unnerved and stares at Jennifer, showing some distraction or preoccupation.
Directly questions Jennifer's intrusion with calm confidence.
Shrugs and does not answer Jennifer's direct questions about the mysterious man or how he knows his name.
Engages Jennifer in conversation by shifting topic to Italian food and suggesting a meeting to talk more about mythology.
Shrugs and says he doesn't know who the man last night was, despite the man knowing his name.
Deflects questions instead of directly answering them, showing reticence and evasiveness.

Changes the subject unexpectedly to invite Jennifer to meet, while keeping control of the conversation.
Apologizes to Jennifer for being late.
Is evasive when Jennifer asks about his ring and background.
Arrives late to the meeting with Jennifer without a clear explanation.
Keeps a bandage on his arm indicating he is tending to his injury from Kilvara's blade.
Responds evasively and confidently when questioned about his background by Jennifer.
Expresses direct interest in getting to know Jennifer better.
Notices Jennifer's discomfort and questions it.

Ignores Jennifer's question about what she saw the other night.
Engages Jennifer by asking if she told Lieutenant Bedsoe about her theory.
Maintains composure and reveals nothing when confronted with mysterious information about immortal beings.
Uses directness to engage Jennifer and notice her discomfort, showing situational awareness.
Deflects Jennifer's probing question about a mysterious sighting by redirecting her to seek official channels.
Studies Jennifer thoughtfully, locks eyes deeply, and compliments her intelligence with a warm tone.

Explains logically about the rocks and the tunnel collapse, showing understanding of the situation.
Recognizes Jennifer's insight and suspects she knows about immortals, showing perceptiveness.

Leaves the conversation abruptly after acknowledging Jennifer's intelligence, which could be seen as avoidance.

Returns to Jennifer's apartment and asks politely to come in.
Shares a personal story and reveals knowledge about Jennifer's family history, showing trust and sincerity.

Remains silent and walks off when Jennifer asks a direct and important question about his past.
Shows deep reflection and internal struggle when alone, indicating thoughtful consideration.

Reveals detailed and accurate historical knowledge about the ring and Jennifer's ancestry without hesitation.
Observes Jennifer’s doubt and notices subtle emotional reactions, showing perceptiveness.

Pulls away from a kiss, indicating restraint despite emotional connection.
Demonstrates his immortality by stabbing himself with a dagger and showing no lasting harm, proving his extraordinary resilience and control.
Acknowledges the inevitability of conflict with the other immortal, indicating acceptance of responsibility and readiness to confront challenges.
Stops Jennifer from kissing him by putting his finger over her lips, showing self-control and focus on the mission ahead.

Greets Bedsoe politely despite tense situation.

Does not show fear or aggression under threat, maintaining composure.

Confused moment before suddenly stabbing Jennifer in the chest.
Immediately rushes to the scene after the threatening phone call, showing readiness and decisive action.

Blocks Kilvara's sword attack effectively at the start of the fight.
Side-steps a powerful sword strike which then slices a table in half, showing alertness and agility.
After Kilvara swings at his knees, MacLeod jumps and immediately counterattacks with a kick to the face, knocking Kilvara down and disarming him.
Recognizes the urgent threat to Jennifer with the rope about to snap and makes a quick, decisive decision to save her despite having limited time.
Runs and jumps across tables while under pressure, demonstrating physical skill and tactical awareness.

Successfully withstands the transfer of Kilvara's power despite intense pain, and prepares himself after the explosion, indicating resilience and readiness.
Nods at Bedsoe to silently acknowledge and respect his decision not to be taken to the hospital, indicating mutual understanding.
Puts his arm around Jennifer and walks off with her, showing affection and connection.
Slices the blade into his palm to confirm the wound does not heal and calmly affirms that the fight is over, showing awareness and control.
Engages in unspoken but clear communication with Bedsoe, conveying understanding without confrontation.
Decides to walk away from the scene after resolving the conflict and ensuring justice, showing confidence and emotional intelligence.
